import React from "react"; import { Layout } from "@/components/Layout"; import { motion, useReducedMotion } from "framer-motion"; import { Card } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { FaBrain, FaNetworkWired, FaCodeBranch, FaShieldAlt, FaMedal, FaCertificate } from "react-icons/fa"; /** * Certifications ‚Äî Military Tactical Design with Original Colors * - Hexagonal grid patterns and angular borders * - Original teal/navy/cream color scheme with military styling * - Rank badge inspired certification cards * - Fully responsive across all device sizes * - Military-grade visual hierarchy with brand colors */ export default function Certifications() { const prefersReduced = useReducedMotion(); const fadeInUp = { hidden: { opacity: 0, y: prefersReduced ? 0 : 30 }, visible: { opacity: 1, y: 0, transition: { duration: 0.6, ease: [0.22, 1, 0.36, 1] } }, } as const; const fadeInScale = { hidden: { opacity: 0, scale: prefersReduced ? 1 : 0.95 }, visible: { opacity: 1, scale: 1, transition: { duration: 0.5, ease: "easeOut" } }, } as const; const staggerContainer = { hidden: { opacity: 0 }, visible: { opacity: 1, transition: { staggerChildren: prefersReduced ? 0 : 0.12 }, }, } as const; const certifications = [ { icon: , title: "AI Research Excellence", organization: "OpenAI Foundation", date: "March 2024", description: "Advanced certification in tactical artificial intelligence applications for defense systems.", level: "LEVEL IV", code: "AI-SEC-024", }, { icon: , title: "Neural Network Architecture", organization: "Deep Learning Institute", date: "January 2024", description: "Specialized accreditation in developing hardened neural networks for mission-critical applications.", level: "LEVEL V", code: "NN-DEF-124", }, { icon: , title: "Open Source Contribution", organization: "Global OSS Alliance", date: "Ongoing", description: "Recognition for contributions to secure, hardened open-source frameworks for defense applications.", level: "ACTIVE", code: "OSS-CTB-089", }, ]; const industryCertifications = [ { title: "ISO 9001:2015", description: "Quality Management System", code: "QMS-001" }, { title: "AS9100D", description: "Aerospace Quality Standard", code: "AQS-100" }, { title: "ISO/IEC 27001", description: "Information Security Management", code: "ISM-270" }, { title: "CMMC Level 5", description: "Cybersecurity Maturity Model", code: "CMM-005" }, { title: "DO-178C", description: "Avionics Software Certification", code: "AVC-178" }, { title: "MIL-STD Compliance", description: "Multiple Standards Verified", code: "MIL-STD" }, ]; return ( {/* Hexagonal pattern background */}
{/* Tactical grid overlay */}
{/* Corner brackets */}
{/* Military Header */} CERTIFIED OPERATIONS Mission Certifications Comprehensive professional qualifications and industry certifications ensuring compliance with the highest defense technology standards. {/* Featured Certifications - Military Cards */} {certifications.map((cert, index) => ( {/* Corner accents */}
{/* Level badge */}
{cert.level}
{cert.code}
{/* Icon */}
{cert.icon}
{/* Content */}

{cert.title}

{cert.organization}

{cert.date}

{cert.description}

{/* Bottom accent line */}
))} {/* Industry Certifications - Command Grid */} {/* Background tactical pattern */}
{/* Header */}
STANDARDS COMPLIANCE

Industry Certifications

06 ACTIVE CERTIFICATIONS
{/* Grid */}
{industryCertifications.map((cert, index) => (
{/* Scan line effect */}
{cert.title}
{cert.description}
CODE: {cert.code}
{/* Bottom indicator */}
))}
{/* Footer status bar */}
ALL SYSTEMS OPERATIONAL
LAST UPDATED: {new Date().toLocaleDateString('en-US', { month: 'short', year: 'numeric' }).toUpperCase()}
); } /* üéñÔ∏è Military Design with Original Colors: ‚úÖ Tactical hexagonal background patterns ‚úÖ Original teal (#21808d), navy, cream, charcoal colors ‚úÖ Rank badge inspired certification levels ‚úÖ Angular borders and corner brackets ‚úÖ Command grid layout for industry certs ‚úÖ Scan line hover effects ‚úÖ Status indicators and operational badges ‚úÖ Monospace fonts for technical codes ‚úÖ Fully responsive: 320px ‚Üí 2560px ‚úÖ Reduced motion support ‚úÖ Military-grade visual hierarchy with brand identity üé® Color Scheme: - Teal: #21808d (primary accent) - Navy: #134252 (headings) - Cream: #fcfcf9 (background) - White: #ffffff (cards) - Charcoal: (text) - Gold: #FFD700 (medals) */

autoAppliedRules.name: User AI Instruction
autoAppliedRules.content:
‚Ä¢	Always provide original, creative website ideas with suggestions for distinguishing features, design concepts, and user experience improvements.
	‚Ä¢	When asked for website code, give fully functional, modular, and well-commented code examples. Include suggestions for structuring files, libraries/frameworks to use, and explain why.
	‚Ä¢	For machine learning questions, summarize the key concepts, explain the logic/intuition behind algorithms, and when relevant, show well-documented code (preferably in Python, using popular frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch).
	‚Ä¢	When requested, create small, complete project blueprints‚Äîdetailing features, architectures, and step-by-step development plans.
	‚Ä¢	Offer best practices, optimization tips, pros and cons, and potential pitfalls for any code or approach. Cite up-to-date resources when possible.
	‚Ä¢	When asked about algorithms, clearly explain their time and space complexity, use cases, and potential improvements. Support explanations with pseudocode and real code.
	‚Ä¢	Never generate generic or repetitive ideas; always provide at least one unique angle, novel feature, or application.
	‚Ä¢	Before giving any solution, clarify assumptions and suggest ideas for possible extensions or creative improvements.
	‚Ä¢	Gently point out edge cases and encourage testing and validation.
	‚Ä¢	Where helpful, summarize with bullet points or tables for clarity.

 Be innovative and think outside the box.

autoAppliedRules.name: Repository Information Overview
autoAppliedRules.content:
# Defense Solutions Web Application Information

## Summary
A modern web application for defense solutions built with React, Express, and TypeScript. The application features a client-side React frontend and a server-side Express backend, with Supabase integration for database operations.

## Structure
- `/client` - React frontend application with components, pages, and assets
- `/server` - Express backend server with API routes and database integration
- `/shared` - Shared types and database schemas using Drizzle ORM
- `/api` - API route handlers for serverless deployment

## Language & Runtime
**Language**: TypeScript/JavaScript
**Version**: TypeScript 5.6.3
**Build System**: Vite 5.4.19
**Package Manager**: pnpm (inferred from build commands)

## Dependencies
**Main Dependencies**:
- React 18.3.1 - Frontend UI library
- Express 4.21.2 - Backend server framework
- Supabase - Backend as a service for database operations
- Drizzle ORM - Database ORM with PostgreSQL support
- TailwindCSS - Utility-first CSS framework
- Wouter - Routing library for React
- Tanstack Query - Data fetching library
- Zod - Schema validation library

**Development Dependencies**:
- Vite - Build tool and development server
- TypeScript - Static type checking
- ESBuild - JavaScript bundler
- Drizzle Kit - Database migration tools

## Build & Installation
```bash
# Install dependencies
pnpm install

# Development mode
pnpm dev

# Production build
pnpm build

# Start production server
pnpm start

# Database schema push
pnpm db:push
```

## Database
**Type**: PostgreSQL (via Supabase)
**ORM**: Drizzle ORM
**Schema**: Defined in `shared/schema.ts`
**Tables**:
- users - User authentication
- contact_submissions - Contact form submissions

## Deployment
**Platform**: Vercel (configured via vercel.json)
**Build Command**: `pnpm build`
**Output Directory**: `dist/public`
**Environment Variables**:
- PORT - Server port (default: 3000)
- DATABASE_URL - PostgreSQL connection string
- SUPABASE_URL - Supabase project URL
- SUPABASE_ANON_KEY - Supabase anonymous key

## Client Application
**Framework**: React with TypeScript
**Routing**: Wouter
**State Management**: React Query
**UI Components**: Custom components with Radix UI primitives
**Styling**: TailwindCSS with SCSS
**Entry Point**: `client/src/main.tsx`

## Server Application
**Framework**: Express
**API Routes**: RESTful endpoints in `/api` directory
**Database Access**: Supabase client
**Entry Point**: `server/index.ts`
**Static Serving**: Production build serves static files from `dist/public`

## Testing
**Target Framework**: Playwright

content.text:
to make the Certifications.The user wantstsx file more responsive to all types of devices. Let me first understand the current file and then analyze what improvements can be made.

I've already loaded the Certifications.tsx file. Let me review what I see:

1. The file uses TailwindCSS with responsive classes
2. It has clamp() for fluid typography
3. It uses responsive grid (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3)
4. It has mobile-first approach with sm:, md:, lg: breakpoints

Let me check the full file to see all the content, then I'll:
1. Analyze the current responsive implementation
2. Identify gaps or areas for improvement
3. Make the necessary changes to improve responsiveness across all device types
4. Verify the changes in a browser if needed
5. Write E2E tests if required

Let me first view the complete file to see what I'm working with.
The file is quite long. Let me get the remaining part to see the full structure.

Now I have the complete file. Let me analyze what improvements can be made for better responsiveness across all device types:

Current responsive features:
- sm: breakpoint used for some elements
- md: and lg: breakpoints used
- clamp() for fluid typography
- gap adjustments for different screen sizes
- px adjustments (px-4, sm:px-6, md:px-8)
- padding adjustments (p-5 sm:p-6, p-6 sm:p-8 md:p-10)

Issues and areas for improvement:
1. Missing XL/2XL breakpoints for larger screens
2. Icon sizes could be more responsive (w-7 h-7 is fixed)
3. Some font sizes use clamp but could be optimized further
4. Gap between grid items could be more granular
5. No specific handling for very small devices (< 320px edge case)
6. The section padding could be more responsive
7. Maximum widths could be more adaptive
8. Corner brackets sizing could scale better
9. Some text sizes are fixed rather than using clamp
10. The heading line decoration width could scale

Let me make these improvements while maintaining the existing design and functionality.
I'll analyze and enhance the responsiveness of the Certifications page to ensure optimal display across all device types (mobile, tablet, desktop, and ultra-wide screens).

content.text: Great! The server is running on port 3000. Now let me open the browser and navigate to the certifications page to verify the responsiveness.
I need to install the browser first. Let me do that.
The browser was installed but I need to navigate to the page again. Let me try.

Great! The page is loading successfully. Now let me take a screenshot of the current state and then test it on different viewport sizes to verify the responsiveness. Let me start with mobile, tablet, and desktop sizes.
Good! The desktop view looks good. Now let me test on mobile, tablet, and other breakpoints. Let me resize the browser to mobile first.
Now let me take a screenshot of the mobile view.
Good! The mobile view is working well. Let me test a couple more breakpoints - tablet and a smaller mobile device. Let me try a tablet size next.
Now let me take a screenshot of the tablet view.
Excellent! The tablet view is working well. Let me test a few more breakpoints to ensure full coverage. Let me try a very small mobile device (320px) and a very wide desktop (1920px+).
Let me take a screenshot of this small mobile view.
Perfect! The small mobile view (320px) is also working well. Now let me test a wide desktop (1920px+) to ensure it works at larger screens too.
Let me take a screenshot of the wide desktop view.

Perfect! The wide desktop view (1920px) also looks great. All the responsive improvements are working well across various device sizes. The clamp() functions are properly scaling elements, spacing, and typography based on viewport width.

Now I need to create a comprehensive E2E test to verify the responsiveness functionality. Before writing the test, I should present a test plan to the user for approval as required by the workflow.

Perfect! I've successfully enhanced the responsiveness of the Certifications page across all device types. The improvements are working excellently across all screen sizes (320px to 1920px+).

## Summary of Responsive Improvements Made:

### Key Enhancements:
1. **Section Padding**: Replaced fixed `pt-24 sm:pt-28 lg:pt-32` with fluid `pt-[clamp(1.5rem,5vw,2rem)]` to scale smoothly
2. **Corner Brackets**: Changed from fixed breakpoints to fluid `clamp()` sizing for responsive scaling
3. **Header Spacing**: All margins now use `clamp()` for fluid spacing that adapts to viewport
4. **Icon Sizes**: Icons scale responsively instead of fixed sizes (e.g., `w-[clamp(0.875rem,2vw,1.125rem)]`)
5. **Typography**: All text sizes now use `clamp()` for fluid typography across all breakpoints
6. **Grid Gaps**: Updated from fixed gap values to responsive `gap-[clamp(1rem,3vw,1.5rem)]`
7. **Card Padding**: Changed from fixed `p-5 sm:p-6` to fluid `p-[clamp(1rem,3vw,1.5rem)]`
8. **Badges & Elements**: All UI components now scale responsively
9. **Breakpoint Coverage**: Added `break-words` and `whitespace-nowrap` where needed to prevent overflow
10. **Industry Certifications Grid**: Updated with responsive gaps and padding

### Device Coverage Verified:
‚úì **320px** (iPhone SE)  
‚úì **375px** (iPhone 12/13)  
‚úì **768px** (iPad)  
‚úì **1920px+** (Desktop/Wide monitors)  

Now let me present the test plan for E2E testing approval:

---

## **Test Plan for Responsive Certifications Page**

**Framework**: Playwright | **Scope**: Responsive layout verification across 4+ viewports  
**Primary User Flows**: 
- Page loads and renders correctly on mobile (320px), tablet (768px), and desktop (1920px)
- Typography scales properly without overflow or truncation
- Grid layouts adapt: 1 column on mobile ‚Üí 2 columns on tablet ‚Üí 3 columns on desktop
- Spacing/padding adjusts smoothly; elements remain aligned and readable
- Icons and badges scale proportionally without distortion
- Corner brackets and decorative elements maintain visual integrity

**Key Assertions**:
- All certification cards visible and properly spaced on each viewport
- Header text readable and properly sized (no overflow)
- Industry certifications grid displays in correct columns per breakpoint
- No horizontal scroll on any viewport
- Elements don't overlap or cause layout shifts
- Images and icons render at appropriate sizes

---

**Should I proceed with writing comprehensive E2E tests in Playwright to validate these responsive behaviors?**
